meanings.definition: The act of giving life or vitality to something.
meanings.sent1: The vivification of the garden brought forth colorful flowers and buzzing bees.
meanings.sent2: The vivification of the party was evident as laughter filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The vivification of the old clock made it start dancing around the room!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a vivification, breathing life into the dreary day.
meanings.sent5: The vivification of the music transformed the atmosphere into a lively dance floor.

meanings.definition: The process of making something more lively or animated.
meanings.sent1: The vivification of the painting with bright colors made it stand out in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The vivification of the story with vivid descriptions captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The vivification of the puppet show turned the characters into real-life performers!
meanings.sent4: His energetic speech was a vivification that ignited passion in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The vivification of the movie through special effects made it a thrilling experience for the viewers.
